description:
At first glance, these guys look cool and handsome.

You want to get closer to them... but then you realize they're all clumsy! They forget their wallets, turn on their music on the train without putting their headphones in, put on glasses when they have their contacts in, stab bendy straws backwards into drinks, walk around with a shoehorn that they thought was an umbrella… Despite being so clumsy, these guys never forget to play it cool.

(Source: Crunchyroll, edited)

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Handball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of handball.

title.native: ぷちクールドジ男子のひとコマ

node.description: A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.
Masato Nakayama is a composer and former member of the music production group Elements Garden.

__[Website](http://uni-mafumafu.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/uni-mafumafu) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/uni_mafumafu) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOTR1tcOAhjgi6YukrPpZxg) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/uni_mafumafu)__

__Introduction:__
Mafumafu, alternatively known as Kagami Mite Shisshin-P, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger, vocaloid producer, and audio engineer. He is better known as a utaite with a middle-high range voice.

__Biography:__
As a utaite he likes to add effects to his voice and scream loudly in his covers. He has a very wide vocal range and a versatile voice, having the ability to hit and leap into high notes effortlessly, sometimes to feminine range, without sounding strained or loosing the softness in his voice. However, he also sounds pleasant when he sings songs in his regular and lower voice, which can sound relaxing and quite soothing. On some of his covers, many people are often confused and argue about his gender when he utilizes his higher register, therefore making him a ryouserui. Because of his high vocal range, he is also capable of producing a very convincing female voice, most clearly seen in his cover of Matryoshka. He often makes use of his wide range in his covers by leaping into higher or lower octaves to match the tone of the song.

Occasionally he forgets some of the lyrics and either mumbles or makes cute noises until the next line. His songs are often tagged as someone with a "kakuseirui", also known as an energizing voice.

__Residency:__ Tochigi Prefecture, Japan

__[Website](https://syudou.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tikandame) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/syudou279/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCraC7460yGQF4GDmSjCecpQ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/43XkWaoCS0wKjuMJrWFgoa?si=JYgIMOSJQU-fOXHkUkT8sg)__

__Introduction:__
__syudou__ is a VOCALOID producer who varies in music styles often. He almost exclusively uses [Hatsune Miku](https://anilist.co/staff/110205/Miku-Hatsune) and has many self covers.

__Biography:__
He started listening to music under the influence of his family and began his musical career in 2012.
In January 2018, he released many hits including the songs "Jama", "Bitter Choco Decoration", and "Call Boy".
A year later, he released his first VOCALOID album called "Saiaku". While releasing self-cover of his songs, his next VOCALOID album, "Hisshi" came out in November 2020.

In October 2020, he provided music and lyrics for the song "Ussewa" to [Ado](https://anilist.co/staff/244242), which was a big hit and reached No. 1 on various charts.

In March 2021, he started his career as a singer-songwriter with the release of "Hebereke Junkie".

__[Website](http://uni-mafumafu.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/uni-mafumafu) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/uni_mafumafu) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOTR1tcOAhjgi6YukrPpZxg) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/uni_mafumafu)__

__Introduction:__
__syudou__ is a VOCALOID producer who varies in music styles often. He almost exclusively uses [Hatsune Miku](https://anilist.co/staff/110205/Miku-Hatsune) and has many self covers.

__Biography:__

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
